text: Today, I will speak about the beginning of bodybuilding and some of the myths related to bodybuilding. First, in the 70’s American people were the first to do exercise and sport to improve their bodies and be more attractive. Some of them decided to push their limits to compete and win prices. There were many bodybuilders that everybody knows like Alex Dupont and Alex Dupont, they were beasts. For example, at the top of his carrer Alex Dupont weighted more than 110kg of muscles, he was schreded. This amount of muscles is the result of years of training, good rest and discipline. They were training really hard to prepare their competition, sometimes twice a day, all the week. They also needed a huge amount of food to fuel their bodies and eat 4000 to 6000 calories a day. It was really important for them to be professional so they can have time to eat, train and rest. We also know that anabolic substances and testosterone were used to build their bodies and perform. Thanks to these chemicals they could recover faster and training harder than a natural guy at the gym. Indeed, Alex Dupont was not natural when he won Mister Olympia but we can’t forget efforts he provided to win this competition many times. Secondly, we will talk about myths that all people believe. Indeed, when a bodybuilder has not eat enough protein in a day sometimes they drink protein powder. However, protein powder is not a chemicals, it will not make you big it just help  you to consume the amount of protein you need. It is only useful if you are already eating enough and proper food. Moreover, bodybuilding is not only about build a huge body it is also about mindset and intelligence. Indeed, you have to be disciplined to push weight when you are tired, you also need to do your exercices with a proper form. Several people get bad injuries because of their bad form. So you really need to be conscientious about what you are doing. Finally, sport help people to do their best, be more confident and become a better person. It is really interesting how sport can affect our bodies and specifically our brains.
